Big Data is a term used to describe the massive amounts of data that are being collected, stored, and analyzed by companies. This data can come from a variety of sources, such as customer transactions, social media posts, and sensor data. Companies are using Big Data to gain insights into customer behavior and preferences, as well as to improve their products and services. For customers, Big Data can be used to provide more personalized experiences and better customer service. It can also be used to detect fraud and improve security. Overall, Big Data is a powerful tool that can be used to benefit both companies and customers.

Arithmetic mean is the average of a set of numbers. It is calculated by adding all the numbers in the set and then dividing the sum by the number of numbers in the set. For example, if the set of numbers is 2, 4, 6, and 8, the arithmetic mean is (2 + 4 + 6 + 8) / 4 = 5.5. The arithmetic mean is also known as the average. It is the most commonly used measure of central tendency. Other measures of central tendency include the median and the mode
